Description: Poster showing a black arrow pointing downwards alongside a repeated slogan in Arabic. Computer-generated image, printed on archival paper (A2 Hahnemühle Photo Rag 308gsm).
Producer name: Made by: Alshaab Alsori Aref Tarekh (The Syrian People Know Their Way)
School/style: Middle East & North Africa Modern Art
Curator's comments: These political posters were created digitally and shared on social media between 2011 and 2014. They were also used by activists in the mass demonstrations during the uprisings at the beginning of the Syrian Civil War 2011-. Some of this group of posters were shown a touring exhibition of art from the Syrian Uprising, at the Prince Claus Fund Gallery in Amsterdam, Netherlands, 2012; Rundetaarn in Copenhagen, Denmark, 2013 and Rich Mix in London, 2013 (all curated by Malu Halasa, Aram Tahhan and Nawara Mahfoud, with Donatella Della Ratta in Amsterdam and Copenhagen). Some have also been published in Halasa, M., Omareen, Z. and Mahfoud, N. (2014). Syria Speaks. London: Saqi Books, and in the book's Arabic edition (Dar Saqi: Beirut, 2014)
Funder name: Funded by: Contemporary and Modern Middle Eastern Art acquisition group (CaMMEA)
Acquisition notes: One of a group of sixty-eight political posters by the Syrian poster collective Alshaab Alsori Aref Tarekh (The Syrian People Know Their Way).
